info: Someone [Yukiri](#Yukiri) makes up. She thinks someone needs to mediate between the Ajahs soon or the rebels would “dance in through the front door, bold as theives, and empty the house while the rest of them squabbled over who got Great Aunt Sumi's pewter.”

name: Guardswoman Yurith Azeri
info: Guardswoman in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn. She observed [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin) leaving the city with one of the Sea Folk apprentices.

name: Halima Saranov
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s evening maid. She is actually [Delana](#Delana-Mosalaine)'s maid, but she lends her to Egwene at night to help with her chronic headaches.

name: Halwin Norry
info: First Clerk in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn. He is tall and lean and has a long nose, as well as a fringe of white hair that sticks up around his bald head.

name: Hand of the Shadow
info: Literal translation of the name Shaidar Haran. He is a myrddraal with special abilities that appear to stem directly from the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself.

name: Haral Luhhan
info: Blacksmith of Emond's Field. [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) was his apprentice before he left home. He is a very large man, which works well for work at the forge. His wife, Alsbet, is almost as large as he is, and nearly as strong. He approves of the new arrivals in Emond's Field, and has even ventured into business partnerships with some of the newcomers.

name: Hari
info: Man who travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). He likes collecting ears. He was the one replacing the hot coals on the Aielman's abdomen after he shook them off as a way to torture him into talking.

name: Harine din Togara Two Winds
info: Wavemistress of Clan Shodein for ten years. She negotiated the treaty with [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey) and [Rafela](#Rafela-Cindal) under [Nesta](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons)'s authority. Her Windfinder is Shalon, her sister. Her face is unlined, but white streaks her straight, black hair. According to one of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s viewings, Harine is destined to become the Mistress of Ships of the Atha'an Miere.

name: Harnan
info: Lantern-jawed Tairen Redarm, a file-leader in the Band of the Red Hand. He has a heavy jaw, a long-suffering expression, and a crude hawk tatoo on his left cheek.

name: Hartha
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: First Gardener, the commander of a section of Seanchan Ogier.

name: Haviar
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s spies. He is actually [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s spy (she contends that spying is a wife's job), but Perrin is getting his reports in her absence. He is from Tear.

name: Heartsbane
chapter: Chapter 6: The Scent of a Dream
info: Name used for Shai'tan, the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Herid Fel
info: Late philosopher who worked in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s school of thought at the Barthanes estate in Cairhien. He was torn limb from limb by a _gholam_ for unknown reasons, although it is likely that he had stumbled upon something quite damaging to the cause of the Shadow if they would send a _gholam_ to do the job. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) is currently reading his book, _Reason and Unreason_, in an attempt to better understand why he was murdered. Rand cannot make up from down in Fel's books, but Min finds them fascinating.

name: High Captain Jimar Chubain
info: High Captain of the White Tower Guard. [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) suggested that they order him to increase his recruitment efforts to expand the guard; [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) thought it unnecessary, but that was more of just being blind to what anyone else said.

name: High King Artur Hawkwing
info: Name by which [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Paendrag-Tanreall) was known after his conquest of the entire known world.

name: High Lady Estanda
info: High Lady of Tear, one of those who went into hiding in Haddon Mirk once the battle at Cairhien was over. She has since emerged to become one of the most prominent beseigers of the Stone of Tear.

name: High Lady Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag
info: Second daughter of the [Empress](#The-Empress-of-Seanchan-), heir to the Crystal Throne of Seanchan, and leader of the _Corenne_, the Return. She has brown eyes and no hair (it has been shaved off). She is also called the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), the woman [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) was told he will marry. Mat has since kidnapped her (in a matter of speaking), and she travels with him under strictest secrecy. She is very small—short and slender. She is, however, 20 years old, about the same age as Mat. She has very long eyelashes.

name: High Lord Astoril Damara
info: High Lord of Tear who retired to his country estates years ago. He is [Medore](#Lady-Medore-Damara)'s father. He has since come out of his side despite aching joints to join [High Lord Darlin](#High-Lord-Darlin-Sisnera) inside the Stone of Tear.

name: High Lord Darlin Sisnera
info: High Lord of Tear, one of those who went into hiding in Haddon Mirk once the battle at Cairhien was over. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) says he almost admires him—he opposed Rand from the very start, fleeing the Stone of Tear when it fell and trying to rouse resistance among the rural nobles. He was considering [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s offer of support if he declared himself king of Tear, until he was made the Steward for the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) in Tear. Rand figures that this will keep the nobles scheming among themselves so much that they will not have time to make trouble for him.

name: High Lord Hearne
info: One of the High Lords of Tear. When the battle in Cairhien was over, he and a few other High Lords took to hiding in Haddon Mirk—they were traitors to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He has since returned to Tear, but he worries that he will be trapped there when the other High Lords return from Illian.

name: High Lord Simaan
info: One of the High Lords of Tear. When the battle in Cairhien was over, he and a few other High Lords took to hiding in Haddon Mirk—they were traitors to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He has since returned to Tear, but he worries that he will be trapped there when the other High Lords return from Illian.

name: High Lord Tedosian
info: High Lord of Tear, one of those who went into hiding in Haddon Mirk once the battle at Cairhien was over. He is married to Alteima, but their marriage is not a happy one. He has now emerged, and is the most prominent beseiger of the Stone of Tear.

name: High Lord Turak Aladon
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: High Lord of Seanchan and commander of the Forerunners before his death in Falme. He was killed there when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) bested him in a swordfight. He was a Blademaster, and was quite stunned when Rand was able to match him. He kept a collection of rare _cuendillar_ objects, including (thanks in part to looting Bayle Domon's ship) two seals on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison. Both of these seals broke when the Seanchan were pushed back into the sea at Falme.

name: Hu Marwin
info: Man from Emond's Field. He is an excellent woodsman, and now travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) under [Dannil](#Dannil-Lewin)'s leadership.

name: Irgain Fatamed
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She was stilled by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) during the battle at Dumai's Wells. One of her Warders died from the shock; the other died while killing Aiel, making no attempt to escape. She has since been Healed by [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn), and is now oathsworn to Rand. She has been given special privilege by the Wise Ones, and is free to come and go as she pleases.

name: Iva
info: [Erith](#Erith)'s mother, [Alar](#Elder-Alar)'s daughter.

name: Ivonell Bharatiya
info: Possibly apocryphal historian from before the Trolloc Wars. She wrote of “hounds born of the Shadow, in numbers like unto the nightmares of mankind.”

name: Jaalam Nishur
info: [General Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde)'s tall young armsman. He has a dry sense of humor.

name: Jahar Narishma
info: A man not much past twenty that had the spark of _saidin_ inborn. He is now one of the Asha'man. He is loyal to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), not [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim). Since being placed on the Traitor's List, he has been in hiding—he did not assist in the attack on Rand, but Rand thinks it better to be safe than have him killed. He has since been bonded as a Warder by [Merise](#Merise-Haindehl). He wielded _Callandor_ at the cleansing of _saidin_, though the circle was controlled by one of the women. Merise took away his dragon pin, claiming it was not appropriate for him to wear it in lieu of his new responsibilites as her Warder—Jahar was very angry with her for this, and she will eventually have to learn that he is much stronger than she is, and she needs to give him respect appropriate to that position.

name: Jain Charin
info: Real name of [Jain Farstrider](#Jain-Farstrider). He is a modern hero, a traveler and writer. He is the subject of the book _The Travels of Jain Farstrider_, a popular contemporary novel, and is believed to have translated the Prophecies of the Dragon shortly before disappearing. It is thought that he was a victim of Ba'alzamon's scheming, and he escaped to the Ogier _stedding_ and was never heard from again.

name: Jain Farstrider
info: Hero of recent legend. There is a book about him, _The Travels of Jain Farstrider_, that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) intends to read but never has. The book is quite popular with his friends, including [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran).

name: Jalid Magonine
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: Craftsman from Ancarid (in the lands of the Seanchan), and owner of [Furyk Karede](#Furyk-Karede) and his parents at the time of Furyk's birth.

name: Jameine
info: Hot-eyed seamstress in [Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show. [Olver](#Olver) likes her, along with several other serving girls.

name: Janny
info: [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand)'s handmaid. She has plump cheeks, and has served her for twenty years.

name: Janya Frende
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She is extraordinarily neat, especially for a Brown—every one of her short, dark hairs is exactly in place at all times. She was one of only three sitters to stand for war with Tar Valon when the vote was first called for. She has unwavering support for [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Jaq Lounalt
info: Lean man with huge mustaches. He smiles too much, at least as far as [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) is concerned. He specializes in torture; he can reduce someone to begging in just a few cords.

name: Jesain
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She would be considered short even if she was not Aiel. She has lots of fiery red hair, and a fiery temper to match.

name: Joline Maza
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She was a Sitter for the Green, appointed after one of the Green's sitters left for Salidar. [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) asked her to resign her position after only weeks and sent her to Ebou Dar to meet with [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara. She has two Warders named [Blaeric](#Blaeric-Negina) and [Fen](#Fen-Mizar).

name: Jon Skellit
info: Barber in the pay of House Arawn who works in the Andoran Royal Palace.

name: Jondyn Barran
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Grizzled old man from the Two Rivers. He is a better bowshot than anyone in the Two Rivers except Tam al'Thor and possibly Abell Cauthon, and he is the best hunter bar none. He is also a good woodsman. He always says what he thinks, regardless of who hears. He is now traveling with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Jori Congar
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Man from the Two Rivers. He is very skinny, but still eats twice what anyone else does. He will also drink so he cannot stand if given the chance. He is a good shot with a bow and arrows. He is also a skilled pickpocket.

name: Jori
info: [Morvrin](#Morvrin)'s Warder. He looms over her despite being shorter. He is almost as broad as [Sarin](#Sarin-Hoigan), despite being short, even for a Cairhienin.

name: Juilaine Madome
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, recently raised to a Sitter for the Brown in Tar Valon. She was hand-picked for her spot in the Hall, and not in the usual way the Browns pick. She is tall, attractive, and has short black hair.

name: Juilin Sandar
info: Thief-taker from Tear, one of the best at his craft. He accompanied [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) on their travels because [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) asked him to. He accepted partly out of respect for Lan, and partly out of guilt; he betrayed Elayne, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and Nynaeve to the Black Ajah when Liandrin used Compulsion on him, and later realized how wrong it was. He carries a notched sword-breaker and a staff with which he is deadly. He has fallen in love with [Amathera](#Amathera-Aelfdene-Casmir-Lounault), the Panarch of Tarabon.

name: Julanya Fote
info: One of the Kin. She and [Sabeine](#Sabeine-Ocalin) were sent to visit some of the Andoran villages a few miles south of the border with Cairhien, and the villages reported that they think the armies from the Borderlands were camped for the winter. They were both peddlers for twenty years, making them ideal for the task—they are used to long journeys with little rest.

name: Jur Grady
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Stocky, dark-eyed man, about seven years older than [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Now one of the Asha'man. He accompanied [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) after the episode at Dumai's Wells, and later left with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to seek out [Masema](#Masema-Dagar). He looks like a farmer.

name: Jurad Accan
info: Man who is loyal to [Lord Luan](#Lord-Luan-Norwelyn) “to his toenails,” according to [Mellar](#Doilin-Mellar).

name: Kairen Stang
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She grew up in Andor. She was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and is now traveling with the Tower in exile outside Tar Valon. She is strong in Earth, and is one of the sisters [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) has making _cuendillar_ ornaments. She plans to use her and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) for a special mission.

name: Kalia Karede
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: Late wife of [Furyk](#Furyk-Karede).

name: Karldin Manfor
info: Asha'man who accompanied [Loial](#Loial) to all the _stedding_ and former Ogier groves to seal the Waygates there or warn others to monitor them. Like [Flinn](#Damer-Flinn) and [Narishma](#Jahar-Narishma), he is on the Deserter's List, as is every Asha'man that works with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Kasi
info: Worker in [Beldair](#Mistress-Beldair)'s kitchen.

name: Katerine Alruddin
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. Though she keeps it secret, she is actually of the Black Ajah, and has been for twelve years. She was captured by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) during the battle at Dumai's Wells, but escaped her captors. She has black hair. She and [Tarna](#Tarna-Feir) took rooms in [Garon Burlow](#Master-Garon-Burlow)'s house while the Younglings were there.

name: Keeper of the Chronicles
info: Essentially the secretary to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). The Keeper is traditionally chosen from the same Ajah the Amyrlin was raised from, and wears a stole of the color of her Ajah instead of the striped stole of the Amyrlin. The post was held by [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif) of the Blue Ajah until a coup deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) and stilled both Siuan and Leane. Her successor was [Alviarin Freidhen](#Alviarin-Freidhen) of the White Ajah, despite the fact that Siuan's successor was from the Red. The Keeper for the Aes Sedai who fled the Tower when [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised Amyrlin now have a Keeper of the Chronicles of their own, [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah. In theory, the Keeper of the Chronicles serves the Amyrlin and speaks for the Amyrlin; she is all but separate from her Ajah, although less so than the Amyrlin Seat herself. However, both of the current Keepers have tried to expand their powers over the Amyrlin they serve, although for vastly different reasons—Alviarin is essentially trying to weaken Elaida and have herself or another Black sister raised in her place after Elaida is deposed; Sheriam tries to overstep [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) because she has a hard time thinking of Egwene being anything more than the frightened novice that came to her study not so long ago.

name: Kenly Maerin
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Young man from the Two Rivers with a scraggly beard.

name: Kin Tovere
info: Cairhienin who made [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s spyglass.

name: King Ailron
info: King of Amadicia until the Seanchan invaded. He was not as strong as most kings due to the control of the Children of the Light—in fact, he had almost no real power at all. During the invasion, he took his army to engage the invaders near Jeramel; they were slaughtered, and Ailron himself was captured in what [Valda](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Eamon-Valda) now calls “Ailron's Disaster.”

name: King Alsalam Saeed Almadar
info: King of Arad Doman. He has been a good ruler for over twenty years, though the Council has recently smuggled him out of Bandar Eban—after leaving the city, he seems to have taken on the notion that he is the Rebirth of [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing).

name: King Easar Togita
info: King of Shienar. He has a square face, and white hair in a topknot. He is a head shorter than [Paitar](#King-Paitar-Nachiman) of Arafel. Sadness is a permanent presence in his eyes. His third son is married to [Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu)'s daughter. His wife died about eleven years ago. He is currently in the Braem Wood with the rest of the rulers of the Borderlands.

name: King Paitar Nachiman
info: King of Arafel, brother of Kiruna. His face is creased, though he was once stunningly handsome. He is tall. He wears his gray hair cut short. He has a deep voice and broad shoulders. His favorite granddaughter is married to [Ethenielle](#Queen-Ethenielle-Kirukan-Materasu)'s son.

name: King Roedran Almaric do Arreloa a'Naloy
info: King of Murandy, at least in name. In reality, Murandians hold allegiance to lords only, and those lords often refuse to pay their taxes to the King. He hopes to make himself the first _true_ king of Murandy in its history.

name: Kireyin
info: Commander of the Ghealdanin lancers that travel with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) after [Alliandre](#Queen-Alliandre-Maritha-Kigarin) was captured. He was quite likely nobly born. He is tall.

name: Kirstian Chalwin
info: One of the Kin. She has black eyes, and is quite pretty. She sat on the Knitting Circle. She is very strong in the One Power, and because of this was chosen to hold Ispan Shefar's shield during her captivity. She held a small weaver's shop in Ebou Dar until the city was overrun by the Seanchan. She looks about 70, but she actually ran away from the White Tower about three hundred years ago.

name: Koimal
info: [Ledar](#Ledar)'s grandfather, [Shandin](#Shandin)'s son. He does not actually exist....

name: Kwamesa
info: Sitter for the Gray Ajah, the youngest Sitter in the Hall of the Little Tower. She is dark and slender, has a sharp nose, and has strength in the Power; she is on the same level as [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar). She tries to seem tall even though she is not. She grew up in Arafel, and she seems to put great store in ceremony. She is far too young to be a Sitter, at least normally.

name: Lacile Aldorwin
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Tiny woman, taken captive by the Shaido along with [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara).

name: Lady Aedelle Baryn
info: Wife of [Lir](#Lord-Lir-Baryn). Her cook is now in the service of [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne).

name: Lady Aemlyn Carand
info: Andoran lady, High Seat of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled her from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) hopes that she will still support her, but for now she supports [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) for the Throne.

name: Lady Aethelaine
info: Lady of Jurador. She says whatever the salt merchants tell her to say.

name: Lady Ailil Riatin
info: Slim, dignified woman with big dark eyes. Not young, but pretty. She is [Toram Riatin](#Lord-Toram-Riatin)'s sister, and will do anything for him if he asked her to. She is also the daughter of King Galldrian. She is tall for a Cairhienin woman (and _only_ for a Cairhienin woman...). She had pledged for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), but disappeared after the attack by Asha'man. The last Rand saw her, she was bound with the Power under a bed. Since Toram is assumed dead, she is being pressured to assume the High Seat of House Riatin.

name: Lady Alaine Chuliandred
info: Lady of Cairhien. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) first met her at a party at Lord Barthanes's manor, which has subsequently been converted into Rand's institute of scientific research. A year ago, she would have been up in arms against [Fionnda](#Lady-Fionnda-Annariz), not pleasantly chatting wearing scandalous dresses.

name: Lady Arathelle Renshar
info: Andoran noble with more power than any other noble in Andor save [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) and [Luan](#Lord-Luan-Norwelyn). Her army met up with [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s outside Salidar, and she is now in Murandy. Her House wants Dyelin to take the throne, and is very hesistant to support Elayne.

name: Lady Arymilla Marne
info: Brown-eyed Andoran noble with a habit of fainting. She opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. The only real reason [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) kept her around in Caemlyn was to push others into supporting [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin); no one wanted Andor in the hands of Arymilla. Once [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) returned to Andor, she exiled Arymilla as her mother had. However, Arymilla learned of where [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) were being detained in Murandy and rescued them. This debt of sorts bound House Arawn and House Sarand to support Arymilla's claim to the Lion Throne. She now has the support of five major houses of Andor. She is plump, verging on stout, has a vacuous smile, and brown eyes that are almost always wide with interest. Her sign is four silver moons on a twilight blue field.

name: Lady Birgitte Trahelion
info: Captain-General of the Queen's Guards under [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and her Warder. She tells everyone she is from Kandor. However she _is_ actually _the_ Birgitte from the stories.

name: Lady Carlys Ankerin
info: Andoran noble. She and her House support [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) and House Sarand. Her sign is paired white leopards.

name: Lady Catalyn Haevin
info: High Seat of House Haevin. She is a dark-eyed young woman, though barely more than a girl. She pledged the support of her House to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). She is very presumptuous and snooty, especially for someone who had not even heard of [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne) (Elayne claims that miners in Baerlon had heard Lord Bryne's name). Her sign is a blue bear.

name: Lady Daerilla Raened
info: Andoran noble. She and her minor House support [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and House Arawn. Her sign is five silver stars.

name: Lady Danine Candraed
info: High Seat of House Candraed. [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) went to her first to ask after support for [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) for the Lion Throne. Dyelin was convinced that she would never make up her mind after the first hour, which she suspected would be the case from the start anyway, but she stayed three hours to avoid offending Danine.

name: Lady Dawlin Armaghn
info: Andoran noble. He supports [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and House Arawn. His sign is an oak and an axe.

name: Lady Deira ni Ghaline t'Bashere
info: [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s mother. She has raven-black hair winged with white, and is about a head taller than her husband Davram, the Marshal-General of Saldaea. She was stabbed by a man while he was ransacking her tent, but she is alive. She and Davram rarely yell, but they have a very upfront method of conversing with each other that often makes others somewhat uncomfortable. She did not approve of her daughter's marriage at first, but was eventually convinced to accept it.

name: Lady Dyelin Taravin
info: [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s cousin, High Seat of House Taravin, and heir to the Lion Throne if Elayne dies without female children. She has gray-streaked golden hair. She left Caemlyn with [Reanne](#Reanne-Corly) days before [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne)'s army appeared. She became High Seat of her house at age fifteen when her father died in a skirmish on the Altaran Marches.

name: Lady Egeanin Tamarath
info: Seanchan ship captain, later a Captain of the Green, now one of the Blood. Her last name changes each time she gets promoted; her previous last name was Sarna. She fled Ebou Dar as part of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s entourage; she has feelings for [Bayle Domon](#Bayle-Domon), a ship captain whose ship she once boarded and looted.

name: Lady Elenia Sarand
info: Shrewish, honey-haired Andoran noble with an eye for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Her husband [Jarid](#Lord-Jarid-Sarand) opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) exiled her from Caemlyn, as Morgase did long ago, for attempting to take the Lion Throne. She still plans to take it from [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), though once she was rescued from Aringill by [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne)'s men, her claim vanished. Her House now supports Arymilla for the Lion Throne and the Rose Crown of Andor. However, she thinks Arymilla “lacks the wit” to be queen, and Elayne too immature—she is also not above causing “accidents” for her rivals.

name: Lady Ellorien Traemane
info: Andoran lady, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession, and one of Morgase's best friends. Morgase exiled her from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion; when Ellorien demanded to know why, Morgase had her flogged. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) was named after her grandmother. Morgase hopes she will forgive her for what she did and support her when she comes to Andor to reclaim her throne, or at least support [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) in her claim. She and her House have effectively disappeared from the face of Andoran politics for the last few weeks.

name: Lady Eram Talkend
info: Andoran noble. She and her House support [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) and House Sarand. Her sign is a golden winged hand.

name: Lady Evelle Haevin
info: [Catalyn](#Lady-Catalyn-Haevin)'s aunt. She says you should leave swords to men.

name: Lady Fionnda Annariz
info: Lady of Cairhien. She has taken to “scandalous” dress. A year ago, she would have been up in arms against [Alaine](#Lady-Alaine-Chuliandred), not pleasantly chatting with her at a party.

name: Lady Jailin Maran
info: Andoran noble. She and her House support [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) and House Sarand. Her sign is a cross-hatched red wall.

name: Lady Karind Anshar
info: Andoran noblewoman. Her stare allegedly put three husbands under the soil. She was banished from the Palace grounds except for state occasions for opposing [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Third War of Andoran Succession during which Morgase came to power. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), she came to him and tried to win his favor—she only wants to advance her own power and influence in Andor. She has since been re-exiled from the Palace grounds.

name: Lady Mayv Gilyard
info: Late guardian of [Branlet](#Lord-Branlet-Gilyard). She died when her horse stepped into a gopher hole and fell on her. Her replacement is still being chosen, three months after the incident.

name: Lady Medore Damara
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: One of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s new servants, a Tairen woman who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead of spears. She is tall and has bright blue eyes and a dark face. Her father is [High Lord Astoril](#High-Lord-Astoril-Damara). She is a member of the _Cha Faile_ (Falcon's Talon) sept of the Aiel imitators. She and her cohorts now serve as scouts and spies for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Lady Miedelle Caeren
info: Late wife of [Lord Nasin](#Lord-Nasin-Caeren). She died almost thirty years ago. He now seems to think she is [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne)'s mother.

name: Lady Naean Arawn
info: Slim, palely beautiful Andoran noble with big, blue eyes and waves of black hair. She sneers a lot. She opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) exiled her from Caemlyn, as Morgase did long ago, for attempting to take the Lion Throne. She still plans to take it from [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), though once she was rescued from Murandy by [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne)'s men, her claim vanished. Her House now supports Arymilla for the Lion Throne and the Rose Crown of Andor.

name: Lady Nelein
info: [Lord Aedmun](#Lord-Aedmun-Matherin)'s grandmother. He recalled that _everyone_ stepped softly around her.

name: Lady Osana
info: Lady of Arad Doman. She owns a hunting lodge, though her true hunt is for men with power. Her lodge is desolate and run-down, now.

name: Lady Shiaine Avarhin
info: Darkfriend who previously worked for Jaichim Carridin and now commands her own circle of Darkfriends. She tried to kill [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) when she found him and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in a shed on their way from Emond's Field to Fal Dara. She gives orders to [Daved Hanlon](#Daved-Hanlon). She is very stingy, except with her own comforts. She is pretty, and has a slim neck, glossy brown hair past her shoulders, brown eyes, and a smile that never touches them.

name: Lady Sylvase Caeren
info: [Lord Nasin](#Lord-Nasin-Caeren)'s granddaughter and heir. She is sturdy, placid, and unemotional. She has a cow's wits to accompany her cow-like expression.

name: Lady Tamsin Ituralde
info: [Rodel](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde)'s wife.

name: Lady Tigraine Mantear
info: First wife of Taringail Damodred, and [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred)'s mother. She was the Daughter-Heir to the Throne of Andor and daughter of [Queen Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear), but she disappeared. Her disappearance set of the Third War of Andoran Succession. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) was in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn, several people commented on his striking resemblance to Tigraine; this is no coincidence, since Tigraine is Rand's mother. She fled to the Aiel Waste upon a warning from Gitara Moroso to become a Maiden of the Spear, and gave birth to Rand when the Aiel were fighting near Tar Valon. Her maiden name was Mantear.

name: Lady Tuva
info: Lady of Arad Doman. She was killed by a Gray Man whom she was trying to keep from killing [Alsalam](#King-Alsalam-Saeed-Almadar).

name: Lady of the Shadows
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: Seanchan euphemism for death, as in “swallowed by the Lady of the Shadows.”

name: Lamgwin Dorn
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: [Breane](#Breane-Taborwin)'s boyfriend, a hard, bulky man from Caemlyn. He lived as a street thug, but was loyal to his queen. He joined [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) when she left the country, and has since become [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s bodyservant.

name: Larine Ayellin
chapter: Chapter 30: What the Oath Rod Can Do
info: Novice from Emond's Field. She was a close friend of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s growing up. She is a member of [Nicola](#Nicola-Treehill)'s “family.”

name: Latelle Luca
info: Woman with a stern face and dark eyes that performs with bears in [Valan Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s menagerie. She is Valan's wife. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) suspects that [Latelle](#Latelle-Luca)'s bears do their tricks for fear she might bite them.

name: Latian
info: Pale Cairhienin man with a sharp nose. He travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). He is one of the people who attempts to imitate the Aiel, using swords instead of spears.

name: Leafblighter
info: Aiel name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Leafhunter
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: One of the wolves. She is a female, and carries an air of quiet certainty. She is the leader of her pack.

name: Leane Sharif
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Arad Doman, and has coppery skin. Just as her family members were training her in the seductive ways of Domani women, Leane found that her life would take a different direction: she could channel _saidar_, and would do so with or without teaching. She became an Aes Sedai, a member of the Blue Ajah, and was eventually raised to [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche). During the coup led by [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) and [Alviarin Freidhen](#Alviarin-Freidhen) that deposed Siuan, Leane was thrown in the dungeon and stilled. Leane tried turning to her seductive side to try to replace what she lost in stilling; she was out of practice, but did well enough. She eventually convinced the Aes Sedai in Salidar to let her stay with them and maintain the network of eyes-and-ears she kept in Tar Valon as Keeper. She was later Healed by [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and restored to some of her former capacity for using the One Power. The Hall of the Tower in Salidar decided that since she had been stilled, she was no longer Aes Sedai for that time and thus all of her titles and choice of Ajah were null and void. Instead of petitioning to re-enter the Blue Ajah, she asked the Green Ajah if it would accept her; it did, and she became the first sister to ever switch Ajahs. Her eyes-and-ears as Keeper are retained by her; she was the only Aes Sedai to plant spies in the city itself. These spies are very useful in determining both what is going on in Tar Valon, but also what the Ajahs are leaving out of their reports to [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She has considerable strength with Earth, and is the second best at making _cuendillar_, after Egwene herself.

name: Ledar
info: Ogier, son of [Shandin](#Shandin), son of [Koimal](#Koimal). He stops in Cairhien and talks with [Methin](#Eldrid-Methin) and [Beldair](#Mistress-Beldair). He arrived with [Underhill](#Master-Underhill), his traveling companion. The name Ledar is actually a traveling name, as is Underhill; their true identities are the Ogier [Loial](#Loial) and the Asha'man [Karldin Manfor](#Karldin-Manfor). The _real_ Ledar wrote _A Study of Men, Women, and the One Power Among Humans_ about three hundred years ago.

name: Leilwin Shipless
info: New name for [Egeanin](#Lady-Egeanin-Tamarath) that [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag) gave her as a shea dancer. Tuon demoted her out of the Blood to the status of a shea dancer when she gave Egeanin the necklace [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) had intended for Tuon.

name: Leilwin
info: Pseudonym used by [Egeanin](#Lady-Egeanin-Tamarath) to conceal her true identity while traveling with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). She claims the name is Taraboner. She and Mat are posing as lovers to evade suspicion.

name: Lelaine Akashi
info: Slender Sitter for the Blue Ajah in Salidar. She carries a dignified air about her. She was a Sitter in the White Tower for forty years until [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed. She is quite old. She now leads one of two factions that divides the Hall of the Tower under [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Lemai
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, now captive with the Asha'man. She told the captive Aes Sedai that they should be cordial with the Asha'man.

name: Leonin
info: Warder to [Meidani](#Meidani). He has braided black hair that he laces with bells, which presumably means he is Arefellin.

name: Letice Murow
info: Pale-eyed novice close to her middle years. She has a sister who is also a novice. She has unblemished skin that has never spent a day working in a field. She is from Murandy.

name: Lew Therin
info: Misspelling of [Lews Therin](#Lews-Therin-Telamon).

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), Breaker of the World. He was perhaps the greatest man who ever lived, and the most powerful Aes Sedai in recorded history. During the War of the Shadow, he led the forces of the Light against the Forsaken, and led the final stroke which re-sealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) back into his prison. Unfortunately, during this stroke he was driven insane by the Dark One's touch, eventually killing his wife Ilyena, his children, and everyone he loved, as well as anyone who carried a drop of his blood. For this act, people remember him with a new name: Kinslayer. After he had done this, Ishamael gave him his sanity back long enough for him to realize what he had done; Lews Therin killed himself by drawing on _saidin_ too heavily, causing a mountain to form on the spot where he stood. This mountain is called Dragonmount, and is near the present-day city of Tar Valon. It is unfortunate that the name of one of the greatest men to ever live is now synonymous with evil, for Lews Therin killed his family due to the Dark One's influence, but without Lews Therin there may not have been a world left in which to kill them. Lews Therin's voice often speaks inside [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s head, offering advice or sobbing over lost women or ranting about killing men who can channel. It even tries to seize control of _saidin_ sometimes, much to Rand's fear—Rand is certain that Lews Therin cannot take control of _saidin_ away from him if he seizes it first, but he is almost as certain that if Lews Therin seizes it first, he will not be able to snatch it back.

name: Lieutenant Caseille Raskovni
info: Under-lieutenant in the Queen's Guards of Andor. She is a lean, hard woman from Arafel. She spent twenty years as a merchant's guard, and is now a member of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s personal bodyguard. [Birgitte](#Birgitte) thought she would be a bannerman at heart.

name: Lieutenant Rasoria Domanche
info: Stocky underlieutenant in [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s palace guard. She looks with suspicion on everyone except [Aviendha](#Aviendha) and [Birgitte](#Birgitte). She is from Tear, though she has blue eyes and yellow hair that she keeps cut short. She insists on watching the cooks make Elayne's meals and tasting everything first, to make sure it is safe for Elayne to eat.

name: Lieutenant Tumad Ahzkan
info: Young lieutenant in [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s army, and commander of his personal escort. He can think clearly and see beyond what is in front of him. He is tall, though still two hands shorter than [Bael](#Bael), and has a thick black beard. Bashere is grooming him for a higher rank.

name: Lieutenant Tzigan Sokorin
info: Ghealdanin under-lieutenant in the Queen's Guards of Andor, and a member of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s personal bodyguard. She claims to be the daughter of a minor noble, and was a Hunter for the Horn before joining the Guards.

name: Lini Eltring
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Childhood nurse to [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain), [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) Trakand. She has many wise sayings, which Elayne and Morgase are fond of quoting to themselves and others (probably because they have been ingrained into their minds so much). She went with Morgase when she fled Andor to Amadicia, and now serves as [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s chief maid. She is bony, and has white hair.

name: Llyw
chapter: Chapter 30: What the Oath Rod Can Do
info: [Kairen](#Kairen-Stang)'s Warder. He is as wide as a horse.

name: Logain Ablar
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who created war in Ghealdan and surrounding nations before being captured and gentled by the Red Ajah. He got loose during the chaos surrounding the deposing of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), and eventually was escorted out of Tar Valon by Siuan and her traveling companions. Before he was gentled he was of considerable strength, and attracted quite a following of loyal soldiers. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) still has viewings of him with a halo over his head, which she thinks indicates that he will become a figure of great power sometime in the future. Recently, Logain later came forward with information that indicated that the Red Ajah actually put him up to declaring himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), most likely with the pretext that bringing down a false Dragon would bring more glory than gentling a simple man who could channel. Logain was recently Healed by [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and was let free by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to do as he pleased. He chose to go to the Black Tower, and now leads a part of the Asha'man that seem to be discontent with [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s leadership. When Aes Sedai came to the Black Tower to attempted to capture the Asha'man (not realizing their numbers), Logain bonded two sisters to him as “wives” using the “wife bond” that the Asha'man developed, [Toveine Gazal](#Toveine-Gazal) of the Red Ajah and [Gabrelle](#Gabrelle) of the Brown Ajah. He has curly black hair and broad shoulders.

name: Loial
info: Son of Arent son of Halan, an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He left the _stedding_ at around age 90 to see the world; by Ogier standards, he is not yet old enough to leave the _stedding_ without permission from the Council of Elders. He is fond of books and history, and is an excellent Treesinger. He is writing a book about his travels with the three _ta'veren_ he meets, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Loial is constantly afraid that his mother will find him and try to marry him off and settle him down; however, he does like his mother's choice of wives for him, [Erith](#Erith). In fact, the primary reason he fears returning to Stedding Shangtai is because he is convinced that his mother will insist he and Erith get married on the spot if he does, and he will not be able to finish his book. He has been traveling around to all of the _stedding_ and former Ogier groves with [Karldin Manfor](#Karldin-Manfor), one of the Dedicated, to either seal the Waygates there or warn others to monitor them for Trolloc activity. Like most of the Ogier, he is sad that most humans do not remember the Ogier, and is horrified that some even think he is a Trolloc on first seeing him.

name: Long Tooth
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Name the wolves give to [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera); the name is used because of the long knife Elyas uses to hunt with, which the wolves see as a long metal tooth.

name: Lopin
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He has a round belly, and little hair.

name: Lord Abaldar Yulan
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: Captain of the Air and pilot of a Seanchan _raken_.

name: Lord Abelle Pendar
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but she hopes he will still support her when she comes to reclaim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) hopes he will support her claim to the throne. He seems to disappear easily and at random, and for now he is effectively in hibernation from the point of view of Andoran politics.

name: Lord Aedmun Matherin
info: High Seat of House Matherin in Andor. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) paid his estates a visit to ensure his loyalty after she took the throne—his House is too small to be of much help before, but a good ruler prepares for the after as well as the before.

name: Lord Agelmar Jagad
info: [Easar](#King-Easar-Togita)'s general in Shienar. He is possibly the best military commander alive (excepting possibly [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), the Aiel chiefs, and a few Seanchan commanders).

name: Lord Algarin Pendaloan
info: Lesser Lord of the Land in Tear. He has a wrinkly face and a white beard. He provided accomodations for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin), [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin), [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and the rest of their group on his manor so they could recuperate from the events at Shadar Logoth. His younger brother [Emarin](#Emarin-Pendaloan) could channel, and Algarin wants to be tested for the ability now as well.

name: Lord Ankaer
info: Lord of Arad Doman. He is now Dragonsworn, and as powerful among them as [Shimron](#Lord-Shimron).

name: Lord Arendor Haevin
info: [Catalyn](#Lady-Catalyn-Haevin)'s uncle. He loves hunting, and according to Catalyn he is getting old, though in truth he is the same age as [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin).

name: Lord Bertain Gallenne
chapter: Chapter 6: The Scent of a Dream
info: Commander of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s Winged Guards, and her personal bodyguard of sorts. He is missing one eye, and wears a leather patch over it. He has shoulder-length gray hair.

name: Lord Bertome Saighan
info: Short, ruggedly handsome lord of Cairhien with the front of his head shaved. He is Colavaere's cousin, and since her death has become High Seat of House Saighan.

name: Lord Branlet Gilyard
info: High Seat of House Gilyard. He is a boy with unruly black curly hair and blue eyes that are too big for his face. He pledged the support of his House to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) during his first ever visit to Caemlyn. His voice is in the process of deepening.

name: Lord Captain Commander Eamon Valda
info: Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light after the death of [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall). He killed Niall's assassin shortly after the act, but it is not known whether this was set up, or whether Valda just happened to be in the right place at the right time. One of his first acts was to dismiss Niall's secretary, [Sebban Balwer](#Sebban-Balwer), for “someone who didn't twitch”—this was a mistake, as Balwer was Niall's _true_ Master of Spies—he knows more about spying than anyone else in the world. Valda offered assistance to [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), as Niall had promised, but before doing so he required a “service” of her—to share his bed. Morgase escaped during the Seanchan attack, and Valda believes her to be dead.

name: Lord Captain Commander Pedron Niall
info: Former Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, highest officer among the Children. He was one of the great military commanders of the world, in company with [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and several Aiel chiefs. He was trying to get Altara and Murandy to cede land to Illian so the Council of Nine would not invade both countries. He also tried to expand Amadicia's borders into parts of Ghealdan. His headquarters were in Amadicia, and he ruled there even above [King Ailron](#King-Ailron), although this was not spoken of openly. Niall once offered a treaty with [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, offering Whitecloak assistance to retake her throne in exchange for Whitecloak presence in Caemlyn and elsewhere in Andor, a presence that Morgase had not allowed even a fraction of during her reign. Niall was killed by his alleged Spymaster, Abdel Omerna, who claimed he had gone against everything the Children stood for by allowing Morgase to avoid being put to the question. He was replaced by [Eamon Valda](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Eamon-Valda), who also killed Omerna. Rumor puts him dead in a duel or a skirmish.

name: Lord Conail Northan
info: High Seat of House Northan. He is tall and lean, has bony arms, an engaging grin, merry brown eyes, and an eagle's beak of a nose. He is not much older than sixteen. He thinks [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne) is incompetant, and pledged the support of his House to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Lord Cowlin
info: Lord of So Habor, a village [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s army stops at to get grain and other supplies. Lord Cowlin fled the town for fear of his wife's ghost—the city of So Habor appears to be haunted.

name: Lord Davram t'Ghaline Bashere
info: Lord of Bashere, Tyr, and Sidonia; Guardian of the Blightborder; Defender of the Heartland; Marshal-General to [Queen Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi) of Saldaea. He is also her uncle, and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s father. He has black eyes, a beak-like nose, and a mustache. He is also slender, and shorter than most men; his wife towers over him. He left Saldaea with his army on an order from Tenobia to bring her the head of [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) after he escaped; he ended up in Caemlyn when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) defeated [Rahvin](#Rahvin). He now commands Rand's troops in Caemlyn (those that cannot channel and are not under the command of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) or one of the Aiel chiefs). He is feared by any potential opponents in battle, and with reason—he is one of the best generals alive. He carries a baton made of ivory tipped with a gold wolf's head.

name: Lord Dobraine Taborwin
info: Cairhienin noble. He is the High Seat of House Taborwin, and commanded the troops [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) led to Dumai's Wells. He is little taller than [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and has dark eyes and gray hair. He keeps the front of his head shaved, and keeps the gray hair on the sides to his shoulders. He was the only Cairhienin noble to retain a sizable force after the Shaido invasion. He is the Steward of Cairhien for the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn); he rules the country in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s absence, and serves as his advisor in his presence.

name: Lord Gaebril
info: Man who came to Caemlyn just as riots sprang up throughout the city. He joined and led the faction that restored order in the city, and upon [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s return, he gave her her kingdom in one piece, as it was when she left. Allegedly, she was so happy that he had done this that she made Gaebril her new advisor. However, during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s trip through Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter, Mat overheard Gaebril ordering someone to kill Elayne and anyone else with her—he tried to find a way to report this information to Morgase, but ended up telling Elayne. Gaebril was discovered to be [Rahvin](#Rahvin), one of the Forsaken, who has a preference to having pretty women around him. His “pretty woman” was Morgase, and he planned to wrest control of Andor from her. Morgase realized he was controlling her and left the country so quickly a rumor sprang up that she had been killed; when Caemlyn was taken by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and Rahvin killed, the rumor changed to say that Rand had killed Morgase, instead of Gaebril.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
info: Former First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to the position because Morgase had no living male relatives, but was exiled from Caemlyn on a suggestion from Morgase's new advisor, [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He moved to his private estates in rural Andor, where he presided over the trial of three young women who unintentionally burned a barn: they turned out to be [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the former [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat); [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), the former [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), and [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). When these three made an oath to serve him and then apparently broke it, he followed them out of sheer curiosity to Salidar. Once there, he discovered the true identity of the three, as well as that the Tower was truly broken. The Aes Sedai in Salidar persuaded him to command the army they would need to take the Amyrlin Seat from [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), since he was the only commander that the Warders thought would be willing and able to help them. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). Although neither of them would admit it, Bryne seems to be developing feelings for Siuan Sanche; he wishes to avoid another mistake like his relationship as [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s lover, and also never forgave Siuan for when she publicly shamed him years ago. She seems to be developing similar feelings for him, much to her dismay. He planned to be the first general to take the city of Tar Valon; the closest anyone else ever came was with Guaire Amalasan's armies, who got as far as the White Tower itself, and [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing), who never managed to go beyond beseiging the city. Actually, Amalasan's troops never beseiged the city, they simply managed to breech the walls; Hawkwing never managed to stop the supply ships coming up the river. Bryne thought he will be able to overcome this problem by purchasing ships along the way to Tar Valon, but when [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) brought the entire army to Tar Valon by Traveling, that plan faltered; instead, he is pressuring her to let him use gateways to breach the walls and get inside the city. He is stocky, with a bluff face. The years have given him some sort of comforting calmness. Men always follow him—they have learned from history that doing so is the path to military victory.

name: Lord Gregorin Panar de Lushenos
info: Former member of the Council of Nine in Illian, now named Steward for the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) in Illian.

name: Lord Jarid Sarand
info: [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand)'s husband, the High Seat of House Sarand. A square-faced man, he is dark for an Andorman. During the Succession, Jared's House opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand); after she became Queen, he was only allowed into the Palace on state occasions. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) and took control of Caemlyn until he could find [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), Jarid tried to make himself fall into favor, thinking he could gain power with the new ruler. He and his wife have been exiled, and now support [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne)'s claim to the Lion Throne, but if Elenia attempts to claim the throne for herself, Elayne expects him to assist her. He is very honorable, almost too much so.

name: Lord Lir Baryn
info: “Whip of a man” who always wears a sword. He was one of the nobles who opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Slender and strong, he is the High Seat of House Baryn. He was exiled from the Palace except for official functions by Morgase after she took the Lion Throne, but he invited himself back when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) forced [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) out of town. He has since been exiled again by [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Lord Luan Norwelyn
info: Andoran noble, High Seat of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hoped he would still support her when she returned to claim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) also hopes he will support _her_ claim to the throne despite Morgase's actions. He leads one of the small armies that encountered [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and her group of Aes Sedai on their way to Tar Valon. His retainers have effectively disappeared from Elayne's view, and she remains uncertain whether he will support her claim to the Lion Throne.

name: Lord Machir
info: Lord of Arad Doman. [King Alsalam](#King-Alsalam-Saeed-Almadar) sent him orders that conflicted with those [General Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde) sent out, causing great problems with Ituralde's plan of action.

name: Lord Maringil
info: Cairhienin lord. He had white hair to his shoulders, was blade thin, and icy cool. He was killed by Colavaere because he was competition for the Sun Throne.

name: Lord Nasin Caeren
info: Andoran noble, High Seat of House Caeren. He gave [Arymilla](#Lady-Arymilla-Marne) lodging during her attempts to take the Lion Throne. He has thin white hair, and is stark raving mad. He believes himself betrothed to [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand), despite the fact that she is married.

name: Lord Pelivar Coelan
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but she hoped he would still support her when she came to reclaim the throne. He is one of the lords in Andor who arrested [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) for claiming the Lion Throne; he later led the Andoran troops that confronted the Aes Sedai led by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). He is hesistant to support [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s claim to the Lion Throne, and instead wants [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) to assume the Throne.

name: Lord Perival Mantear
info: High Seat of House Mantear. He is a pretty, golden-haired boy. He pledged the support of House Mantear to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) on his first trip to Caemlyn. His House controlled the Lion Throne until the death of [Queen Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear), both because the Daughter-Heir disappeared and because the family had become heavy with male children.

name: Lord Rahman
info: Lord of Arad Doman. [King Alsalam](#King-Alsalam-Saeed-Almadar) sent him orders that conflicted with those [General Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde) sent out, causing great problems with Ituralde's plan of action.

name: Lord Rajabi
info: Lord of Arad Doman. He is bull-necked. He is now Dragonsworn, and as powerful among them as [Shimron](#Lord-Shimron).

name: Lord Rodel Ituralde
info: General of the army of Arad Doman. He is one of the greatest commanders alive, along with [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), and the Aiel clan chiefs. He keeps a neatly-trimmed mustache, and a ruby in his left ear. He is short in stature. He is called the Wolf by his peers—when the Wolf calls, they follow his lead.

name: Lord Shimron
info: Lord of Arad Doman. He is gaunt and white-haired. Shimron was one of [Alsalam](#King-Alsalam-Saeed-Almadar)'s most trusted advisors until he became Dragonsworn. He is now high in the councils of the the Dragonsworn. He came to greet [Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde) at [Lady Osana](#Lady-Osana)'s hunting lodge.

name: Lord Teacal
info: Lord of Arad Doman. [King Alsalam](#King-Alsalam-Saeed-Almadar) sent him orders that conflicted with those [General Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde) sent out, causing great problems with Ituralde's plan of action.

name: Lord Toram Riatin
info: Cairhienin lord, son of King Galldrian. He is a Blademaster. He opposed Colavaere, and is in league with Caraline and [Darlin](#High-Lord-Darlin-Sisnera) against [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He was last seen running off into the fog of Mashadar that [Fain](#Padan-Fain) released, and is presumed dead.

name: Lord Wakeda
info: Lord of Arad Doman. He is not tall, is missing his right eye, and has a large scar on his face. He is now Dragonsworn, and as powerful among them as [Shimron](#Lord-Shimron).

name: Lord Weiramon Saniago
info: High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) placed him in charge of his campaigns in Cairhien at first. He also controlled part of the massive army Rand sent against Illian. His sign is a silver Crescent-and-stars.

name: Lord Willin Mantear
info: Bedridden guardian of [Lord Perival](#Lord-Perival-Mantear). He is very old, but still considers Perival as a son. He is actually Perival's uncle.

name: Lothair Mantelar
info: Founder of the Children of the Light and author of _The Way of the Light_, the Bible of the Whitecloaks. The book is so revered among the Children that those who cannot read are taught so that they can study Mantelar's words.

name: Lusonia Cole
info: Aes Sedai, one of those displaced from the rooms they took in Dorlan when [Tarna](#Tarna-Feir) and [Katerine](#Katerine-Alruddin).

name: Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: Son of [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing). He led the forces across the Aryth Ocean. When they landed there, he led them to conquer the continent they found for themselves, and declared himself Emperor. His descendants are the Seanchan “of the Blood,” and the rest of the Seanchan are descended from his troops and the native inhabitants.

name: Lyrelle
info: Sitter for the Blue Ajah in Salidar. She is firmly under [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi)'s influence. She was one of only three sitters to stand for war with Tar Valon when the vote was first called. She is tall for a Cairhienin, though that means she is only of average height. Some say she was a dancer before becoming a novice.

name: M'Hael
info: Title used by [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) as the head of the Black Tower. It means “Leader” in the Old Tongue.

name: Magla Daronos
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is a Sitter, and is firmly in [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s camp. She has broad shoulders. She grew up in Illian.

name: Maigan
chapter: Chapter 30: What the Oath Rod Can Do
info: Long-faced, beautiful, large-eyed full-lipped Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She seems elongated somehow, though not tall. She was the Blue Ajah's replacement for [Anaiya](#Anaiya) on [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s “Council” of sisters. She was one of [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche)'s allies when she was [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat), but now she blames Siuan for breaking the Tower. She stands as high as [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) or [Morvrin](#Morvrin) in the Power. Siuan was forced to beg for readmittance into the Blue Ajah, and Maigan was one of the ones who most insisted on the begging. She is [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi)'s to her toenails.

name: Maighdin Dorlain
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Penniless young woman that [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) encountered who was fleeing Amadicia. She did not reveal her true identity, [Morgase Trakand](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor—she uses her mother's name as a disguise. She became one of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s servants, much to her own dismay (being used to _commanding_ the servants, not being one), and was eventually captured by the Shaido and made _gai'shain._

name: Malind Nachenin
info: Plump Sitter for the Green Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She has a round, pretty face with full lips and dark, fierce eyes like those of an eagle. She is from Kandor. She was raised after the sisters banded together in Salidar. She once proposed an “appeal” (i.e., demand) to area nobles for assistance in building their army.

name: Marillin Gemalphin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Brown. She is fond of cats, and is rarely seen without one. She is skinny, has a narrow face, and a wide nose.

name: Marline
info: Wise One with purple twilight eyes and dark hair (which is rare among the Aiel). She came with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Marris Thornhill
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is very mild and always absorbed in study.

name: Martyn Tallanvor
info: One of [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain)'s companions. He is actually a tall young man from Andor who served in the Queen's Guards until [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) fled Andor. When [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) had the guards swear new oaths to the laws and customs of Andor (instead of to the Queen), Tallanvor swore them but immediately went back to his room and reswore the old oath in the old style (cutting his arm with his sword, indicating that his blood will be shed before the Queen's will). He loves his queen more than his life, and now serves as her personal bodyguard. He went looking for her himself when Morgase was captured by the Shaido, and brought word back to [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) that the Seanchan were also hunting the Shaido, and an alliance might be possible.

name: Masalin
info: Gray-haired Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She cannot channel.

name: Masema Dagar
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: The [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He was once one of Uno's underlings, and the one who respected [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) the least, but after he found out that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), he went his own way, preaching of Rand's glory as the “Lord Dragon Reborn.” Rand has since dispatched [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to bring Masema back into line. He is stark raving mad, and very dangerous. He even claims that Masema Dagar is dead, and that he has been resurrected as the Prophet of the Dragon Reborn. He is described as a dark, frowning man of average size with a faded arrow-scar on his cheek. He cares nothing for appearances, least of all his own. He has deep-set, almost black eyes.

name: Master Garon Burlow
info: Mayor of Dorlan, a town the Younglings pass through, and owner of its largest house.

name: Master Harnder
info: Second Librarian in the Royal Palace of Caemlyn. He is chubby and bald, and blinks incessantly. [Reene Harfor](#Reene-Harfor) thinks he is a spy—he frequents the Hoop and Arrow, allegedly to support his cravings for the ale [Mistress Fendry](#Millis-Fendry), the innkeeper, makes, but every time he visits she sends one of her pigeons north. If he is indeed a spy, he is the first spy reported for an Ajah besides the Red; [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) dismisses Red spies as holdovers from when [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was the Queen's advisor, but spies from other Ajahs are not so easily explained.

name: Master Underhill
info: Traveling companion to [Ledar](#Ledar). He has pale hair. The name is actually a pseudonym; his real name is [Karldin](#Karldin-Manfor).

name: Master of the Blades
info: The next step up from Swordmaster among the Sea Folk. It is the highest position a man can hold amoung them. He protects the [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships).

name: Masuri Sokawa
chapter: Chapter 5: The Forging of a Hammer
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She grew up in Arafel, and was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company. She is taller than [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan) by a hand. One of her largest interests as a Brown is the history of Darkhounds; she has been in contact with more Darkhound packs than just about anyone else alive.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attacks after Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence. These gaps were filled and more when he passed through the twisted door to the land of the Eelfinn, where he was granted his three requests: a foxhead medallion that protects him from women's channeling, a way out of the land of the Eelfinn, and the memories of past lifetimes that were the gaps in his memory. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has found that battles are the ultimate form of gambling, and along with his newfound memories he can win almost every battle he fights quite decisively. He has four sisters, including Eldrin and [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon), who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father Abell is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the World. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. In the Waste, he met a woman named Melindhra, a Maiden of the Spear from the Shaido Clan. However, she was not the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), who Mat is destined to marry according to the Aelfinn; besides, she tried to kill him on orders from her master among the Darkfriends. Mat had to kill her to save his own skin, but regretted it deeply. He also has a scar along his neck from where the Eelfinn tried to kill him—which was also in accordance with what the Aelfinn told him, that he is “to die and live again.” He created an army called the Band of the Red Hand, after the army of King Aemon of old Manetheren, and served in a way as Rand's personal general—this worked well, since Mat seems to be a better general than even [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), who has earned his reputation as one of the best commanders alive. Mat does not trust any Aes Sedai, and because of this refuses to take his foxhead medallion off even to take a bath. Mat went to Ebou Dar to try to keep an eye on [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) and prevent them from getting themselves killed. While there he was cornered by [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar), who gave him little choice but to become her lover. When the Sea Folk and the Seanchan did battle in the city, he made his escape, leaving Tylin tied up under the bed so it looked “official”—Tylin was found torn limb from limb, obviously by the _gholam_ which was no doubt sent to kill Mat. In the process of leaving, Mat also took several _sul'dam_ and _damane_ (who were subsequently freed from their collars), and even kidnapped [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag), the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons) herself. Mat is traveling with [Valan Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show now, to keep out of Seanchan sight.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who wreaked havoc in Saldaea before being captured by Aes Sedai. He later escaped his captors, possibly with Black Ajah assistance (although this is totally unconfirmed). Hearing of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty, Taim came to Caemlyn and became the head of Rand's school of male channelers. He is almost as strong in the One Power as Rand is. Taim claims to have held off the madness that normally accompanies the taint for almost 35 years—he has been using the One Power for a very long time, and knows many tricks that Rand had not thought of on his own or been taught by Asmodean, such as how to test men for the ability. He seems to resent being second to Rand, and also gave orders to kill Rand. He is almost as tall as Rand, has a hooked nose and dark eyes. He is a physically powerful and graceful man, although his skill with a sword is lacking. He gives special training to about 20 or 30 men—they are the only ones who wear the dragon besides [Logain](#Logain-Ablar)

name: Meidani
info: Tall, slender Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She has dark golden hair. Her Warder is [Leonin](#Leonin). She was one of the Aes Sedai sent back to the Tower by the Aes Sedai in Salidar as a spy under the guise that she was obeying Elaida's summons.

name: Melaine
info: Wise One of the of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and was one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She can channel. She swore she would never love a man, but changed her mind later and married [Bael](#Bael), her clan chief, thus becoming sister-wife to Dorindha. She has sun-colored hair and green eyes. She is currently expecting twin daughters.

name: Melitene
chapter: Chapter 4: The Tale of a Doll
info: [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s _der'sul'dam_. She is skilled in more than just training _sul'dam_. Less black than gray in her hair.

name: Merana Ambrey
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah with hazel eyes. She is now an apprentice of the Wise Ones. The events following Dumai's Wells shook her so deeply that [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) thinks she will never quite recover herself. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) says that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be able to trust her. She is one of those now sworn to obey him.

name: Merilille Ceandevin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Tiny, slender, and palely elegant, she has glossy black hair and large liquid eyes. She grew up in Cairhien, and has been Aes sedai for more than 100 years. She was originally sent to Ebou Dar to convince [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) to support the Salidar Aes Sedai.

name: Merise Haindehl
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah from Tarabon. She has dark hair and very blue eyes. She has three Warders, including [Jahar Narishma](#Jahar-Narishma), one of the Asha'man.

name: Mesaana
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, Mesaana was told she was unfit to do research at the Collam Daan, but was capable of teaching others. She spent her years teaching until the Bore was opened and she dedicated her life to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). During the War of Power, she created “schools” for the children, at which she taught the children to spy on their parents and other such things. After her release from the Bore, Mesaana set herself up in the White Tower, where she could control events without anyone suspecting she was behind them. She has been cooperating with [Semirhage](#Semirhage) to some extent, and has taught [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) to Travel. She was displeased that Alviarin had ordered [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) beaten.

name: Metarra din Junalle
info: Big-eyed Sea Folk Windfinder apprentice. She is as strong in the One Power as [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) is. She is plump yet solid.

name: Metwyn
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He is the best among the Redarms with a sword. He looks like a boy, despite being about ten years older than Mat. He grew up in Cairhien, and has a weakness for tavern brawls.

name: Millis Fendry
info: Innkeeper at the Hoop and Arrow, an inn in Caemlyn. [Master Harnder](#Master-Harnder), the Second Librarian, claims to have a weakness for her ale. She keeps pigeons, however, and sends one of them north every time he visits. She also received three hooded guests, who were reported to be Brown Aes Sedai, behind closed doors for over an hour—this leads [Mistress Harfor](#Reene-Harfor) to believe that Harnder and Fendry are both spies for the Brown Ajah.

name: Mistress Beldair
info: Chief cook in an inn in Cairhien where [Samitsu](#Samitsu-Tamagowa) stayed for a while. She is stout and tall for a Cairhienin, nearly as tall as Samitsu. She has gray hair. She also greeted [Ledar](#Ledar) and [Underhill](#Master-Underhill) upon their arrival.

name: Mistress Millin
info: Woman who owns a cattle barn in Dorlan that the Younglings use for their horses while passing through the town.

name: Mistress Vadere
info: Innkeeper of The Golden Barge, the inn the Merchants' Guild of So Habor meets in.

name: Mistress of Novices
info: The Aes Sedai who is in charge of training novices and Accepted in the White Tower. The post was held by [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah until a coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) chased her out of the Tower. The post is now held by [Silviana Brehon](#Silviana-Brehon) in Tar Valon and [Tiana Noselle](#Tiana-Noselle) among the Aes Sedai who fled to Salidar. Another Mistress of Novices in the past was [Sereille Bagand](#Sereille-Bagand), who later became the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat).

name: Mistress of the Ships
info: Commander of the entire fleet of Sea Folk vessels. The post is held be the formidable Nesta din Reas Two Moons.

name: Miyora
info: Plump leopard trainer in [Valan Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show.

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Spider” in the Old Tongue. She always works from safety, attacks from safety, and will run unless she can do so. She developed a command of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ that surpassed even Lanfear's mastery—in the real world, Lanfear was more powerful, but even she could not top Moghedien in the World of Dreams. After being released from the Bore, Moghedien eventually found herself in Tanchico, in the Palace of the Panarch of Tarabon. While there, she chanced upon [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), who was trying to save the Panarch at the time and take the seal on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison from its hold in the Palace. She and Nynaeve fought in a duel to the last, and Nynaeve managed to better Moghedien, much to the surprise of both of them. She managed to escape Nynaeve's tied off shield, and on their next encounter, this one in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, she ripped [Birgitte](#Birgitte)'s soul out of the World of Dreams after Birgitte almost killed her. On her third encounter with Nynaeve, Nynaeve managed to trap Moghedien with an _a'dam_. Moghedien remained bound by that _a'dam_ in Salidar, disguised as Marigan.

name: Moiraine Damodred
chapter: Chapter 6: The Scent of a Dream
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born of a noble House in Cairhien, she is Taringail Damodred's youngest half-sister, and King Laman's niece. She is considered short among her people, and the Cairhienin are already a short people. When it was discovered that she had the ability to channel inborn, Moiraine went to Tar Valon to become an Aes Sedai. Just before being raised to the shawl, she and her friend [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) witnessed Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). Moiraine and Siuan walked away from each other and did not speak to each other again (at least in public), but both held secret communication with each other and dedicated their lives to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Moiraine found the young man she sought on Winternight in Emond's Field, a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), along with two more _ta'veren_, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and two women with the spark of the Power inborn, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). When Moiraine was shortly raised to the shawl, she met [al'Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned King of Malkier, who was fighting alone against the Shadow in the Blight; she asked Lan to become her Warder, and he accepted. She is very strong in the Power, stronger than almost all living Aes Sedai. In the Stone of Tear, Moiraine confronted and killed the Forsaken Be'lal with balefire, just before he would have killed Rand. Later, after having an inkling of the future events from the testing _ter'angreal_ for the Wise Ones, Moiraine managed to push the Forsaken Lanfear through the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_. Other Aes Sedai consider her a legend, not only for discovering the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) but for defeating two of the Forsaken as well.
